intro: Panicum leptomerum, commonly known as slender panicgrass, is a perennial grass native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist to saturated soils. The plant features slender, erect stems that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, adorned with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a single, narrow spikelet that produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Panicum leptomerum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
